mention.text: the radical populist who campaigned for a bold transformation of the Soviet economy on the principles of free enterprise
a holiday in the republic to mark
Preliminary reports from the cities of European Russia , Siberia and the Soviet Far East
Yeltsin , 60 , winning more than 50 percent of the vote -- and often 70 percent --
Nikolai Ryzhkov , the former Soviet prime minister
the Russian federation , the largest Soviet republic
a celebration of the Russian federation 's sovereignty
the people of the Soviet Union 's largest republic
the radical leaders of Moscow and Leningrad
Gavriil Popov and Anatoly A. Sobchak
First secretary of Moscow Communist Party
